attributes.comment:
This proposed rate hike of 66% for immigration related fees seems to fly in the
face of any common sense for 2 reasons.

First of all most private companies seem to be able to significantly increase their
productivity or reduce their costs by applying modern information technologies.
E.g. the price of an average computer went down from $2000 10 years ago to
about $600 now. The same is true for software. Moreover there has never been as
much free open source software available. Why should the government be an
exception?

Secondly, significantly increasing fees for legal immigration will only re-enforce
illegal immigration. Most legal immigrants run up a bill of tens of thousands of
dollars related to their paperwork and legal fees already. Who could still afford to
legally migrate if this is increased with 66%?

Finally, USCIS already tagged on quite a bit of fees after 9/11 to fit the bill for
increased screening, etc., Where did that money go?
attributes.title: Comment Submitted By Anonymous
